intro: Paphiopedilum appletonianum var. hainanense, commonly known as the Hainan lady's slipper, is a rare and exotic orchid native to the mountainous regions of Hainan Island in China. It is characterized by its striking, velvety purple and white flowers with a distinctive pouch-shaped lip. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat. This variety is highly valued in horticulture for its unique appearance and rarity.
